Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav hit the winning run to help India win by 6 wickets with 1 ball remaining
New Zealand's lowest total against India in a full-length T20I (99 for 8)
India restricted New Zealand to only 6 fours and no sixes in their innings
Pre-Game Insights: Mitchell Santner opted to bat after winning the toss
India brought in Yuzvendra Chahal for Umran Malik, giving them four spin-bowling options
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav was named the Man of the Match
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Ekana Stadium had hosted five T20Is, with the team batting first winning on all five occasions
Spinners bowled 30 overs in the match - the second-most in any T20I, and the most in a game involving Full Member teams
Others: Jacob Duffy bowled the first over of the chase but from there till the 18th over, New Zealand bowled only spin from both ends
Ishan Kishan was run out for 19 off 32 balls by an excellent piece of fielding
